text: Various shots of the empty, cobble-stoned, other worldly streets of Bruges, Belgium. It’s winter, and a freezing f covers everything; the Gothic churches, the narrow canals their odd little bridges. We could be in any period of th last five hundred years. We happen to be in the present d RAY speaks over all this.

After I killed them I dropped the gun in the Thames, washed the residue off my hands in the bathroom of a Burger king, and walked home to await instructions. Shortly thereafter the instructions came through - "Get the fuck out of London, you dumb fucking cunts. Get to Bruges”. I didn’t even know where Bruges fucking was. FADE TO BLACK.
It's in Belgium. OPENING CREDITS. ‘
SOUND ONLY of two men walking, a train in the background.
Bruges is a shithole.
Bruges is not a shithole.
Bruges is a shithole.
Ray, we've only just got off the fucking train. Could we reserve judgement on Bruges until we‘ve seen the fucking place?
I know it’s gonna be a shithole.

KEN and RAY walking through the pretty Christmas-tide str from Minnewater Park to the Burg; past quaint chocolate shops, past horse and carts, past canal boats, past touri taking photos of all these.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 2. KEN, pop-up map in hand, is enjoying the novelty of the place, which irritates the sulky RAY no end. By the end o the walk we have passed most of Bruges picturesque places none of which could be described as a shithole.
Shithole.
They arrive at their pretty canalside hotel, KEN looking over.
Looks quite nice. RAY just looks at him.
A small (five room) family-run place; a breakfast room of the lobby, a narrow set of carpeted stairs to the first ( only) floor, and a small front desk that nobody’s at. KEN rings the bell.
Great service.
(quietly) Cheer... fucking... up, or I will smack you... in your fat... fucking... head.
Yeah? You and whose army? Your mum’ s?
Are you twelve years fucking old? MARIE, the pretty, heavily pregnant receptionist/owner of about thirty, appears behind the desk, obviously having heard.
Oh, hello...
No, I’m not twelve years fucking old. RAY sits, in a mood.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 3.
I think we have a couple of rooms booked with you, under Cranham and Blakely.
Yes. No, we have one room booked. One twin room.
oh.
Booked for two weeks.
Two weeks?!!
Do you have another room?
No, I’m afraid we‘re fully booked, with Christmas. Everywhere's fully booked.
KEN looking out at the pretty canal beneath the latticed picture-window. RAY on one of the twin beds, staring at t poky room.
It's very pretty.
Ken, I’m not being funny. We can’t stay here.
We've got to stay here till he rings.
What if he doesn't ring for two weeks?
Then we stay here for two weeks.
For two weeks?! In fucking Bruges?! In a room like this?! With you?! No way.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 4.
Ray, I really don’t like to say this...
You really don’t like to say what?
Well, y'know, I wasn’t the one who killed the little kid, Ray. The life totally drains from RAY’S face as he turns blear eyed, sickened, sad.
(quietly) Fucking bring that up... RAY goes into the bathroom, closes the door.
(quietly) Well... I wasn’t.
RAY looks at himself in the mirror, then breaks down in silent tears. He cries them all out, cleans himself up. L at himself again. Breathes deeply.

RAY and KEN at the back of a canal-boat, half full of tourists, sightseeing the waterways. The dull DRIVER ‘dro on, the usual quips. RAY stares at KEN as he does so; KEN enjoys the sights. He has a pocket guidebook with him, wh he consults now and then. We see various of the town's picturesque places.
Do you think this is good?
Do I think what is good?
Y'know, going round in a boat, looking at stuff.
Xes. I do. It’s called sight-seeing. KEN observes the sights further.
Look at that.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 5.
Look at what?
It’s a former hospital. RAY looks at him blankly.
From the eleven-hundreds. RAY looks at him blankly.
Bruges is the most well-preserved medieval town in the whole of Belgium, apparently RAY looks at him blankly. KEN can only smile.
KEN looking at the buildings of the 13th century Benedict convent.
This here...
Ken! It’s just all old buildings!! Can we go and get a fucking beer, please? I assume they have beer in this fucking country.
They have over three hundred different types of beer.
Ken, I just want one. RAY walks off. KEN follows.
RAY happily plonks two pints in front of them, KEN’s an o coloured one in a strangely shaped glass.
Now this is more like it. Proper holidays. One gay beer for my gay friend, one normal beer for me, because I am normal. Ahh! Dis is duh loif.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 6.
We're not staying here getting pissed, We're quietly sight-seeing, like he says, and awaiting his call to see what we do next. RAY hands KEN an English newspaper.
Ken. Read it. They haven't got a single lead.
They say they haven’t got a single lead.

Ken, come on, they're the English police. When they say they haven't got a single lead, they haven’t got a single lead. This is my vote of what we should do. We give it another day, two days max, then we check the papers again and if there’s still nothing in ‘em we phone him and say “Harry, thank you for the trip to Bruges, it’s been very nice, all the old buildings and that, but we're coming back to London now and hide out in a proper country where it isn’t all just fucking chocolates”.
My vote would be we quietly sight- see, like he says, and we await his call to see what we do next. RAY sneers, drinks, gestures to the paper.
Close that up. As KEN closes the paper we glimpse the edge of a headline reading ‘'...IN SHOOTING DEATH OF LITTLE TOBIAS’.
You don’t even know that we're here hiding out.
What are you talking about?
You don’t even know that we’re not here on a job.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 7.
What? On a job?
Yeah.
Here in Bruges?
Yeah.
Here in Bruges, on a job?
Yeah.
Why, what did he actually say?
He didn’t actually say nothing.
So why do you think it might be...

I don’t think anything. But it’s a bit fucking over-elaborate, isn’t it? "Go take him to hide out”. “Go take him to hide out where?” “Go take him to hide out in fucking Bruges”. (pause) You can hide out in Croydon.
(thinking) Mm. Or Coventry. Hmm. It is a bit over-elaborate. Hmm. But we ain’t got no guns.
Harry can get guns anywhere.
Hmm, interlesting. velly interlesting.
RAY sitting at window, looking at the beautiful night-lit canal. KEN lying on the bed, reading a book, ‘THE DEATH O CAPONE’ by K.K.KATURIAN.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES ~ 29/12/2006 8.
He ain’t gonna ring tonight. KEN keeps reading.
(pause) How did Capone die?
(finishing his cheesecake) Neuro-syphilis. RAY nods, looks out window again.
He ain‘t gonna ring tonight. Let’s go out.
Go out where?
The pub.
No.
Let's go out and look at some of all the old medieval buildings and that, cos I bet they look even better at night, all lit up. KEN smiles, puts down his book.
Yes!

They wander the beautifully lit buildings, sculptures and little bridges around the museum, KEN consulting his guidebook, RAY with two beer bottles in his trousers fron pockets and one in his hand, happy out.
This is the smallest bridge in Bruges.

Ahh, it‘s so little, look at it. Bhh. Hello little bridge. How would a little bridge‘s voice go? (in a little bridge’s voice) "Hello. I’m a little bridge”.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 9.
Yeah, go easy on the fucking beers now, Ray.
I am! SCULPTURE GARDEN.
These are the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse. Designed by Rik Poot, it says. Rik Poot.
Hmm. They're not the real Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse though, are they? They’re more sort of robot versions. .
Yes, well, I guess they’re more the artist’s impression of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse. The real Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse didn't actually exist.
Didn't they? They were just made up?
Yes. They might exist one day. That’s the whole thing.
I like robot horses. They‘re good. How would a Four Horseman of the Apocalypse’s voice go? Probably angry. “Grrr”. MUSEUM BUILDING.
That there is called the ‘Gruuthuse Museum’.
They all have funny names, don’t they?
Yes, Flemish. In here, this says, the Belgians twice sheltered fugitive English kings from being murdered.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 10.
So they’re not all good.
Henry IV and Charles II, in 1471 and 1651, respectively.

I used to hate History, didn't you? It’s all just a load of stuff that’s already happened. What are they doing over there?! They're filming something... They’re filming midgets!! RAY runs off excitedly.
Ray!

Behind a rope cordon with a few other people, RAY watches crew et al as they set up between takes, dry ice around. RAY'S POV: A little way off, the film’s DIRECTOR is coach JIMMY, a bored American dwarf actor, on how to creep alon tiptoe “like a 1’il mouse”. JIMMY, irritated, is forced t ape this, without enthusiasm. DIRECTOR goes off happy. JI quietly gives him the finger behind his back. END POV. RAY is THRILLED by all this dwarf/film stuff. KEN comes u
Ray, come on, let's go.
My arse ‘let's go’. They’re filming midgets. RAY spots a stunning GIRL ON SET.
Oh my god! Look at that girl! She’s gorgeous! The GIRL smiles over at the overly loud RAY.
Ray? We’re going right now.
Fuck off are we! This the best bit of Bruges so far! You and your buildings. KEN storms off.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 il.
The cute GIRL, CHLOE, gets a coffee. RAY gets one too.
Hello. She just looks at him. He’s smiling gormlessly but seems safe.
Do you speak English?
No.
Ah yes you do. Everybody does. What are you filming midgets for? CHLOE smiles - he’s so genuinely excited by it all.

It's a Dutch movie. It’s a dream sequence. It’s a pastiche of Nicolas Roeg’s ‘Don't Look Now’. Not a pastiche, but a... ‘homage’ is too strong... A ‘Nod of the Head’. RAY is bemused but she’s so cute he doesn’t mind.
Wow, your English is very good. He’s losing her, he knows it. From the depths of his brai finally dredges something up...

A lot of midgets tend to kill themselves. Yes. A disproportionate amount. Of midgets. In comparison to normal people. Herve Villechaise, off of Fantasy Island. I think somebody off ‘The Time Bandits’. A hell of a lot of midgets. Kill themselves. I guess they must get really sad about, like, being really little, and that. People looking at them, and laughing at them. Calling them names. ‘Shortarse’. There's another famous midget I’m missing but I can’t remember. It’s not the R2D2 man, he’s still going. No, it’s somebody else. ause ui {orz)  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 12. RAY (cont'd) I hope your midget doesn’t kill himself. Your dream sequence’ll be fucked.
He doesn’t like being called a midget. He prefers ‘dwarf’.
Well this is my exact point! People going round calling you a midget when you wanna be called a dwarf. Of course you’re gonna blow your head off! She smiles.
My name’s Ray. What’s yours?
Chloe. How did you get past the security men?
Getting past security men, it’s sort of my job.
You're a shoplifter?

No, I'm not a shoplifter. Good joke, though. No, I‘11 tell you what I am at dinner tomorrow night. She laughs, walks away, and RAY thinks he’s lost her, unt she tosses a small card over her shoulder and behind her, into the mud. RAY picks the card up. It reads ‘CHLOE VILLETTE’ and a mo number. He watches her, hoping she’ll look back. She does
How fucking cool. RAY gives the DWARF the thumbs up as he walks away. The D smiles slightly.
As KEN passes up the stairs, MARIE appears behind the des
Mister Blakely?  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 13.
Yes. No, Mister Cranham. No! Yes! Mister Blakely. Yes.
You have a message. She hands him an envelope, blushing, then hurries away ag KEN a little disconcerted at her behaviour.
Leaning on a wall by the night-lit canal outside the hote KEN opens the envelope, sees the typed message is from HA
Shit.

Number one, why aren’t you in when I fucking told you to be in? Number two, why doesn‘t this hotel have phones with fucking voicemail on them and not I have to leave messages with the fucking receptionist? Number three, you better fucking be in tomorrow night when I fucking call again or there’1l be fucking Hell to pay, I’m fucking telling you. Harry. KEN sighs, then sees the following hand-written message a the bottom of the card - ‘I'M NOT THE RECEPTIONIST, I'M T CO-OWNER WITH MY HUSBAND, PATRICE’ - signed ‘MARIE’. KEN smiles. In through the yellow-lit windows of the reception, MARIE is quietly talking to her unborn baby.

RAY wanders drunkenly the misty cobbled streets and bridg An odd song plays over, like a gentle music box on LSD. A wanders, there’s a happiness at having met a girl, and a curiosity at finding the night-lit Bruges a lot more interesting than he’d have thought. A child's teddy bear has been left on a canal wall. As RA tries to button up it’s pretty little jacket, the bear’s falls off and into the canal, and RAY is reminded, somewh of why he’s in Bruges.
The room is dark. Sound of RAY stomping up the stairs, ke fumbling, opening the door, turning the light on.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 14.
Turn the fucking light off!
Sorry, Ken.
And keep the fucking noise down! RAY sits on his bed, takes off his shoes.
Someone’s in a mood. RAY turns the light off, lets his shoes clatter to the fl starts taking his clothes off.
You'll never guess what.
Can you shut your fucking mouth please and go to sleep?

Oh, sorry. Except I’ve gotta take my contact lenses out. RAY goes to the bathroom, turns the light on, blinding KE and waking him fully. He resigns himself to it, turning o his back, wide-eyed. RAY returns with glasses on.
Altogether I’ve had five pints of beer and six bottles... No, six pints of beer and seven bottles, and y'know what? I’m not even pissed! KEN just stares at the ceiling.
You’1l never guess what, Ken? (pause) Ken, you'll never guess what?
What?
I’ve got a date for tomorrow night.
I’m so happy for ya.
With a girl.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 15.
Can you turn the light off, please?
Only been in Bruges one day, got a date with a girl in the film business. The Belgium film business. They're doing a film about a midget. (pause) Harry didn’t ring, did he?
Can you turn the light off, please? RAY does so, and gets into bed.
Told you he wouldn't.
A small pretty church in a run down area. KEN loitering outside.
FLASHBACK. CONFESSIONAL. The faces of RAY and FATHER MCHE a priest in his sixties, can just be seen in the darkness The crucifix on MCHENRY's signet ring glints now and then
Take your time, son. Just take your time.

What’s your name, Father? PEWS. Outside the confessional, a LITTLE BOY of seven is kneeling, awaiting his turn. He goes over his crimes on h fingers, but can’t remember them properly. He takes out a scrap of paper and looks at it.
It's Father McHenry. What’s your name, son. Just your first name? CONFESSIONAL.
It's Ray, Father. Raymond.
And what is it you’ve done, Raymond?
Murder, Father.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 16.
Murder? Why did you murder someone, Raymond?
For money, Father.
For money? You murdered someone for money?
Yes, Father. Not out of anger, not out of nothing. For money.
And who did you murder for money, Raymond? RAY clears his throat.
You, Father.
I’m sorry...?
I said “You, Father”. What, are you deaf? MCHENRY recoils from the gauze as RAY cocks his gun.

Harry Waters says ‘Hello’. RAY shoots him point blank. MCHENRY bursts out of his lit compartment, clutching his stomach. RAY shoots him again. MCHENRY wrenches open the door of the confessional, tryin get away, and, as daylight bursts in from the body of the church, framing him in angelic shafts of light, RAY shoot him in the back four more times, stopping him dead in his tracks. . MCHENRY slowly turns around to face RAY, still framed in doorway, blood trickling from his mouth.

The little boy. RAY doesn’t understand what he’s talking about. MCHENRY f to his knees, then collapses backwards, dead, revealing behind him, still kneeling in the pews, the LITTLE BOY, w head has been blown apart by one of the bullets that pass through the priest.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 17. Horrified, RAY approaches the BOY who, though clearly dea remains kneeling, his hands clasped together in prayer, t scrap of paper between them. RAY falls to his knees, pull the paper from the BOY’s hands. It reads ‘1. BEING MOODY. 2.BEING BAD AT MATHS. 3.BEING SAD’. VIEWED FROM OVERHEAD, KEN comes running down from the bac the church, as RAY collapses, and starts dragging RAY awa their footsteps echoing, leaving the blood-soaked corpses alone and silent and still.

RAY's eyes are open. He looks at the bed beside him. It’s empty. He looks at the blue skies through the latticed windows, then at the grey ceiling, thinking. A tear falls from his cheek. He wipes it, sighs.
KEN having breakfast, looking through his guidebook. MARI passes.
Um, Miss? Marie? I’m sorry about the message last night. The man who left it is a bit of a... Well, he's a bit of a...
Cock?
(smiles) Yes. He’s a bit of a cock. She smiles and passes on. RAY holds a door open for her w a gallant flourish, comes in, sits.
Harry rang last night. We missed it. KEN gives RAY the message, which he reads.
He swears a lot, don’ he?
We're staying in tonight, whatever happens.
Mm. Except... hmn.
Mm except hmm what?  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 18.
Except only really one of us needs to stay in, really.
Uh-huh? And which one of us would that be, Ray? I thought you didn’t like Bruges.
I don’t like Bruges. It’s a shithole. But I did already say I had a date with a Belgian lady in the Belgian film business, which I did already say about before.
Well just don’t get into any fucking trouble. We are keeping a low profile. And this morning and this afternoon we are doing whatever I want to do. Got it?
Of course. Which I presume will involve culture.
We shall strike a balance between culture and fun.

Somehow I believe, Ken, that the balance shall tip in the favour of culture. Like a big fat fucking retarded fucking black girl on a see- saw, opposite... a dwarf. I was down the park one day when I was little and this big fat retarded black girl came up and beat the fucking shit out of me for absolutely no reason. Completely beat the shit out of me.
What does her being black have anything to do with it?

Well, she was black. (pause) She mightn’t’ve been retarded. She might've just been one of them deaf and dumb people, I’m not sure. Whatever she was, she was a cunt. Completely beat the shit out of me! Bitch!  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 19.

KEN and RAY wandering the gallery - various odd paintings including ‘The Judgement of Cambyses’ (a flaying alive) a ‘De gierigaard en de dood’ (a skeletal Death come to coll his due). They end up in front of Bosch’s ‘LAST JUDGEMENT’ which we various details from - freakish demons torturing various people in various freakish ways. KEN and RAY take it all quietly.
I quite like this one. All the rest were rubbish by spastics, but this one's quite good. What’s it all about, then?
Well it’s the Last Judgement. Judgement Day. Y'know?
Oh yeah? What’s that then?
Well it’s, y’know, the final day on Earth when mankind will be judged for all the crimes they have committed. And that.
Oh. And see who gets into Heaven and who gets into Hell and all that?
Yeah.
And what‘s the other place?
Purgatory.
Purgatory. Purgatory’s kind of like the inbetweeny one. “You weren't really shit, but you weren’t all that great, either." Like Tottenham. Do you believe in all that stuff, Ken?
Tottenham?  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 20.
The Last Judgement and the afterlife and... guilt and... sins and... Hell and... all that...? KEN realises that RAY is really looking for an answer.
Um... Oh. Um...
KEN and RAY on a bench, the distinctive Poorterslodge ris up behind them.
I don’t know, Ray. I don’t know what I believe. Um. ¥‘know, I was brought up believing certain things, I was brought up Catholic, which I’ve more or less rejected most of...
Yeah, they’re nuts, aren't they?

But the things you're taught as a child, they never really leave you, do they? So I believe in trying to lead a good life, like if there’s an old lady carrying her shopping home... Well, I don’t try and help her carry her shopping, I don't go that far, but I‘1l certainly hold the door open for her and that and let her go out before me.
Yeah. And anyway, if you tried to help her carry her shopping, she‘d probably think you were just trying to nick her shopping.
Exactly.
This is the world we live in today.

And at the same time, at the same time as trying to lead a good life, I have to reconcile that with the fact that, yes, I have killed people. Not many people. And most of them were not very nice people. Apart from one person.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 21.
Who was that?

This fella Danny Aliband’s brother. He was just trying to protect his brother. Like you or I would. He was just a lollipop man. But he came at me with a bottle. What are you gonna do? I shot him down,
Hmm. In my book, though, someone comes at you with a bottle, I’m sorry, that is a deadly weapon, he's gotta take the consequences.
I know that in my heart, but I also know he was just trying to protect his brother, you know?
I know, but a bottle, that can kill ya. That's a case of "It’s you or him”. If he’d come at you with his bare hands, that'd be different. That wouldn’t've been fair.
But, technically, someone’s bare hands, they can kill you too. They can be deadly weapons too. What if he knew Karate, say?
You said he was a lollipop man.
He was a lollipop man.
What’s a lollipop man doing, knowing fucking Karate?
I'm just saying...
How old was he?
About fifty.  SHOOTING SCRIPT ~ IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 22.
What’s a fifty year old lollipop man doing, knowing fucking Karate? What was he, a Chinese lollipop man?
Course not.
Well then. Jesus, Ken, I’m trying to talk about...
I know what you're trying to talk about...
I killed a little boy. You keep bringing up lollipop men!
You didn't mean to kill a little boy.

I know I didn’t mean to. But because of the choices I made, and the course that I put into action, a little boy isn’t here any more. And he’1l never be here again. (pause) Y'know, I mean here in the world. Not here in Belgium. (pause) Well, he'll never be here in Belgium either, will he? He might’ve wanted to go, when he got older. I don’t know why. And that’s all because of me. He is dead because of me. And I'm trying to... I’m trying to get my head round it, but I can’t. I will always have killed that little boy. And that ain’t ever gonna go away. Ever. Until, maybe, I go away.
Go away where? RAY gives him a look. Suicide is conveyed.
Don’t even think like that.
And even then it mightn’t go away. Looking at that painting of fucking torment and Hell... (MORE)
RAY (cont'd) Jesus, I'm not sure if I fucking needed that right now. The bloke who painted that, he must be bonkers.
Don‘t think like that, Ray. It‘ll get easier. It will.
I think that’s the problem, Ken. I think that’s the problem.
KEN looking up at the 300ft bell-tower, the dominant land of town.
You coming up?
What’s up there?
The view.
The view of what? The view of down here? I can see that from down here.
Ray, you're about the worst tourist in the whole world.
Ken, I grew up in Dublin. I love Dublin. If I’d grown up on a farm, and was retarded, Bruges might impress me, but I didn’t, so it doesn't.
A sign, ‘ENTRY FIVE EUROS’. A stern Belgian TICKET-SELLER (male) behind glass.
Trying to get rid of my coins. There’s 3,.. 3:50. There's 4. 4:10.
0... Oh, 4:90. Will you take
TICKET-SELLER taps the sign.
Entry is five Euro.
Come on, man, it’s ten cents. TICKET-SELLER taps the sign.
Entry is five Euro. KEN collects up all his coins, pays a fifty Euro note. St at the TICKET-SELLER as he gets his change and ticket.
Happy in your work?
Very happy. KEN gives him a look, goes through the turnstile.

RAY sitting waiting outside the tower, watching people pa Christmas stuff, his thoughts on darker things. Some way JIMMY THE DWARF passes, in normal clothes. RAY waves enthusiastically at him, smiling. JIMMY looks at him, the looks away without acknowledging. RAY loses his smile.
(quietly) Little fucking cunt.
KEN climbing the narrow winding wooden staircase to the t top. Reaches the uppermost look-out room, slightly breathless. Takes in the town and environs.
(quietly) I like it here. He sees RAY way down below. Cocks his finger, shoots him an imaginary gun, just for fun.
A massive shadow falls over RAY. Three enormously overwei Americans are standing there, one MAN, two WOMEN.
Have you been to the top of the tower?
Yeah, yeah. It's rubbish.  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 25.
It is? The guidebook says it’s a must-see.
Well you lot ain't going up there.
Pardon me? Why?
I mean, it’s all windy stairs. I'm not being funny.
What exactly are you trying to say?

What exactly am I trying to say? You're a bunch of fucking elephants!! The OVERWEIGHT MAN tries to hit RAY, but RAY dodges and s away from the blows. The MAN tries to catch and hit him b RAY keeps dodging easily.
Come on, leave it, Fatty... The MAN is already puffing, one of the WOMEN is crying. K comes out of the tower.
You are just the rudest man! The rudest man! The WOMEN lead the breathless MAN away.
What was all that about? RAY shrugs innocently. The Americans enter the tower.
They’re not going up there... (calling out) Hey guys? I wouldn't go up there. It’s really narrow and...
Screw you, Motherfucker!! KEN is dumbfounded, open-mouthed. RAY shrugs again.
Americans, ain’ it?  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 26.

Small Gothic chapel, RAY sitting irritated in a pew, watc as KEN quietly ambles, guidebook in hand, surveying the statues and murals, the Stations of the Cross, all candle and warm. KEN ushers RAY over. RAY sighs, refuses - all this holy s is getting to him. KEN ushers him over again, forcefully time. RAY idles over, head bowed, trying not to look at anything with Jesus on it.
Ray, did we or did we not agree that if I let you go on your date tonight, we'd do the things I wanted to do today?
We are doing the things you wanted to do today.
And that we’d do them without you throwing a fucking moody like some five year old who’s dropped all his sweets?
I didn’t agree to that. (pause) I'll cheer up, I'll cheer up.
This here, up there on the altar, is a phial brought back by a Flemish knight from the Crusades in the Holy Land, and that phial, you know what it’s said to contain?
No, what is it said to contain?
It’s said to contain some drops of Jesus Christ’s blood. RAY feigns interest with his eyebrows.
Yeah. That’s where this church gets it’s name, the Basilica of the Holy Blood.
Yeah?  SHOOTING SCRIPT - IN BRUGES - 29/12/2006 27.
